intro: Sicyos debilis, commonly known as the weak cucumber or creeping cucumber, is a herbaceous vine native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes other cucurbits like pumpkins and squash. The plant produces small, green, edible fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are trailing and can root at the nodes. Sicyos debilis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
